_header: This night in my sleep I was aghast
_description: William Dunbar, ‘The Devillis Inquest’ — thirteen or seventeen 5-line stanzas (aabab) with refrain, ‘Renunce ȝour god and cum to me’.

CULLl510.First Lines:
Dremand me thocht þat I did heirThe commoun people ban &
                    sueir…
CULLl510.Last Lines:
…the devill said then of commoun laall men sworne folk man cum
                    to me
CULLl510.Note:
13 stanzas and refrain ‘Renunce ȝour god and cum to
                    me’.
CULLl510.Editions:
Kinsley,  James. 
             William Dunbar, Poems.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1958; repr. 1979: 166-70, textual notes.

CamMagPep2553.First Lines:
Dremand me thocht þat I did heirThe commowne peiple bane and
                    sweir…
CamMagPep2553.Last Lines:
…The dewill said than of commown laall mensworne
                    folk man cum to me
CamMagPep2553.Editions:
Laing,  David. 
             The Poems of William Dunbar.
         2 vols. Edinburgh: Laing and Forbes, 1834; Supplement, 1865: 2.248.
Craigie,  William Alexander. 
             The Maitland Folio Manuscript, Containing Poems by Sir Richard
                Maitland, Dunbar, Douglas, Henryson, and others.
             2 vols. 
             Scottish Text Society
         n.s. 7 (1919), 20 (1927); Edinburgh and London: Blackwood, 1919,
            1927: 1.62-4.

Banna.First Lines:
This nycht in my sleip I wes agastMe thocht the devill wes tempand
                    fast…
Banna.Last Lines:
…Rownand to robene & to dikRenunce thy god & cum to
                    me
